title: Dumbbell Biceps Curl
description: Master the fundamental biceps curl with proper form to maximize muscle activation and prevent injury.

phases.title: Setup
phases.description: Stand tall with feet shoulder-width apart. Hold dumbbells at your sides with palms facing forward. Keep your elbows close to your torso.

phases.title: Curl
phases.description: Exhale and curl the weights up by contracting your biceps. Keep your upper arms stationary - only your forearms should move. Curl until the dumbbells reach shoulder level.

phases.title: Release
phases.description: Inhale and slowly lower the weights back to the starting position. Control the descent - don't let gravity do the work. Maintain tension throughout.

ai_mistakes.title: Elbow Flaring
ai_mistakes.description: Your elbows are moving away from your body during the curl.
ai_mistakes.correction: Keep your elbows pinned to your sides throughout the movement. Imagine holding a piece of paper between your elbow and ribs.

ai_mistakes.title: Torso Swinging
ai_mistakes.description: You're using momentum from your body to lift the weight.
ai_mistakes.correction: Engage your core and keep your torso completely still. If you need to swing, the weight is too heavy.

ai_mistakes.title: Incomplete Range of Motion
ai_mistakes.description: You're not fully extending or contracting during the curl.
ai_mistakes.correction: Start with arms fully extended and curl all the way up until your forearms nearly touch your biceps.

tips: Start with lighter weights to focus on form
Squeeze at the top of the movement for 1 second
Keep your wrists straight throughout the curl
Breathe: exhale on curl, inhale on release
